cards.name: Barten, the Seeking Scholar
cards.originalText:
Whenever you activate a loyalty ability of Barten, the Seeking Scholar, exile the top two cards of your library.
[+1]: Put a card exiled with Barten into its owner's hand, then discard a card.
[-2]: You may play cards exiled by Barten until your next turn.
[-5]: You get an emblem with “If you would draw a card while your library has no cards in it, you win the game instead.”

cards.flavor:
“Reading back through my notes continues to provide questions rather than answers. Eventually it will all be made clear, surely?”
— Barten's Journal, Entry #119

cards.flavor:
“There is no room for error. Instinct has no place here. Only once every possibility is considered can my work be finished.”
— Barten's Journal, Entry #73

cards.flavor: The demons of Ghruulmani rely upon willing hosts to harness their power and affect the world. Some have learned that benevolence and strength together form the sweetest honey.

cards.flavor: Every contract between demon and host is different. Some hosts permanently surrender their bodies, others temporarily. And some choose to live in tandem with their patron demon.

cards.originalText:

cards.name: Tide Wallower
cards.originalText:
Emerge {7}{U}{U} (You may cast this spell by sacrificing a creature and paying the emerge cost reduced by that creature's mana value.)
Trample
As long as Tide Wallower is tapped, creatures with power less than the number of Islands you control can't attack.

cards.flavor:
“To die gloriously is a victory. To live gloriously is something far more.”
— Heilda

cards.flavor: “The souls of demons are as black as the night sky. But our eyes can only see by the light of day. So it is in the between that I make my communion.”

cards.name: Valter, the Final Breath
cards.originalText:
Deathtouch
If a player would discard a card, that player discards it, but exiles it instead of putting it into their graveyard. When they do, you may cast it and spend mana as though it was mana of any type to cast it. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.text:
Deathtouch
If a player would discard a card, that player discards it, but exiles it instead of putting it into their graveyard. When they do, you may cast it and spend mana as though it was mana of any type to cast it. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Xanigan, the Darkened Cloud
cards.originalText:
Whenever you activate a loyalty ability of Xanigan, the Darkened Cloud, you get an emblem with exalted. (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
[+2]: Xanigan deals 2 damage to up to one target and you gain 2 life.
[-3]: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
[-7]: Xanigan becomes a 7/7 Demon creature with flying and indestructible that's still a planeswalker. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to her.
